p: Sesamin has been suggested to be a precursor of the keto-lignan (+)-episesaminone, another furofuran lignan [ 86] ( Figure 9). Episesaminone was isolated for the first time from unroasted and unbleached sesame seeds as well as from freshly harvested seeds of S. indicum [ 86]. In 2006, a diglucoside of episesaminone, episesaminone-9- O-Î²- d-sophoroside, was found in the perisperm of S. indicum seeds [ 96].
